text: You pull into your driveway, excited to see \(babyName) after such a long day. Your neighbor John, who works as a nurse at the local hospital, has also just gotten home.

speaker: Neighbor
text: John waves back and crosses the street for a quick chat. -1 time

speaker: Neighbor
text: Before you can slip away, John waves and crosses the street for a quick chat. You wave back and put on a polite smile. -1 time

speaker: Neighbor
text: “My day? Not great, actually. There was a baby with whooping cough who we're all pretty worried about. She caught it from her brother, who wasn't vaccinated.”
choiceA: How bad could a cough be?
choiceB: I've heard of whooping cough before - could \(babyName) catch it?

speaker: Neighbor
text: "This is what whooping sounds like. In infants, it can cause some severe complications like pneumonia! And since infants don't get the TDaP vaccine until they are 1 years old, they rely on herd immunity or their mother's vaccination during pregnancy."

speaker: Neighbor
text: "Since infants don't get the TDaP vaccine until they are 1 years old, they rely on herd immunity or their mother's vaccination during pregnancy. After all, it takes a village to raise a child!"

speaker: Neighbor
text: "That's great! Vaccination and herd immunity are some of the things, along with clean water and healthy food, that we recommend to improve community health. Speaking of community, are you bringing \(babyName) to the barbeque next week?" +1 community health
choiceB: No, we're going on vacation to Disneyland!

speaker: Neighbor
text: “Whooping cough is highly contagious, and can be preventable with vaccination. The vaccine has undergone decades of safety testing, and is the best way to prevent your child from getting the disease. Since \(babyName) can't get the vaccine until she is a year old, you'll have to be careful to avoid getting her sick.” -1 health
choiceA: I guess vaccination is just a part of keeping \(babyName) healthy, so we'll talk to the doctor about it next time.
choiceB: I still don't plan on vaccinating \(babyName).

speaker: Neighbor
text: "If that's your choice, but I still recommend you do some more research. By the way, are you planning to go to that community barbeque next week?"
choiceB: No, we're going on vacation to Disneyland!

speaker: Neighbor
text: "Great, then I'll see you and \(babyName) there!"

speaker: Neighbor
text: "That sounds fun! I heard there might be a possible whooping cough outbreak, so just be careful. But \(babyName) should be fine, since your whole family was vaccinated before \(pronoun) was born."

speaker: Neighbor
text: "Great, then I'll see you and \(babyName) there!

speaker: Neighbor
text: "That sounds fun! But wasn't there news about a possible whooping cough outbreak?"
choiceA: I've spent too much on this vacation already, so nothing is stopping us from going!
choiceB: If \(babyName) has not been vaccinated, does that mean she could catch it?

text: Feeling reassured that there is little risk of \(babyName) catching pertussis, your family has a great time at the bbq! Everyone compliments the cornbread your family brought and \(babyName) has a lot of fun playing at the park! +1 community health, +1 health

Your family has a great time at the bbq, but you see a child coughing and worry it could be something serious like whooping cough. You end up leaving the bbq early, and stocking up on chicken soup just in case. -1 community health, -1 time

When officials announce a whooping cough outbreak near Disneyland, you feel reassured that \(babyName) is at little risk of developing the disease. +1 health. But you are still afraid to stay and, later, the news says the outbreak originated from a child who had not been vaccinated. You are disappointed that your big family trip has been ruined. -1 money, -1 time.

When officials announce a whooping cough outbreak near Disneyland, and you are afriad to stay since \(babyName) is at high risk of catching the disease. Later, the news says the outbreak originated from a child who had not been vaccinated. You are disappointed that your big family trip has been ruined. -1 money, -1 time, -1 community health.

speaker: Neighbor
text: "It's definitely possible, since \(pronoun) has not been vaccinated."
choiceB: I guess we could go to the bbq instead...

text: It turns out the child had not been vaccinated and did have whooping cough, which \(babyName) caught. You spend the night in the hospital, listening to \(babyName)'s struggle to breathe and wishing you had better taken care of \(pronoun). -2 health, -1 time, -1 money.
choiceA: I'm going to do more research about the risks of childhood diseases so this doesn't happen again.
choiceB: I'm going to talk to \(babyName)'s doctor to prevent this from happening again.
